tasks.name: declaring language for site
tasks.description: HTML: Allows search engines to properly index your site, as it allows assistive technologies to provide the correct responses to the content.

tasks.name: semantic elements: structure
tasks.description: HTML landmark structural elements are semantic - header, footer, aside, article, only one 'main' per page.

tasks.name: semantic elements: details
tasks.description: HTML: H1 - H6 headings have semantic meaning, are used only for headings, are used in the right order, only one H1 per page, usage of <em>, <strong,> when needed

tasks.name: Images in HTML
tasks.description: HTML: There is an alt attribute provided that is descriptive of the image if the image has a functional role/value. Important words in images are text.

tasks.name: background image aesthetic only
tasks.description: HTML & CSS: Background image is for aesthetics and does not matter for the content of your page - otherwise use HTML img

tasks.name: icons
tasks.description: if icons are semantic, they have a text alternative, and even a title attached that describe the function for screen readers

tasks.name: animations
tasks.description: user can turn off or reduce the motion in animations

tasks.name: text contrast
